realsense_camera Documentation

realsense_camera

RealSense Camera package allowing access to Intel 3D cameras and advanced modules

  • Homepage: http://wiki.ros.org/realsense_camera

Overview

This modification to the Realsense R200 library should make it easier to perform stereo vision offboard on the ROS stereo_image_proc node

Changes

  • The IR streams are always active regardless of whether the depth stream is
  • The IR streams are now converted to faux-RGB in order to avoid the mono8 conversion error in OpenCV bridge

Usage

rosLaunch with lemurRS.launch. The camera will publish raw image streams to /camera/ir(2)/image_raw and calibration data to /camera/ir(2)/camera_info. The name of the base nodelet and streams can be reconfigured in the launch file or passed as arguments.

Arguments

Launch Arguments

enable_proc (bool, default: true)
Enable/disable stereo_image_proc node to process ir camera into depth stream
stereo (string, default: 'stereo')
Namespace of stereo_image_proc node in case of multiple cameras

Static Arguments

estimate_median_decrement (int, default: 5)
estimate_median_increment (int, default: 5)
median_threshold (int, default: 115)
score_minimum_threshold (int, default: 1)
score_maximum_threshold (int, default: 512)
texture_count_threshold (int, default: 6)
texture_difference_threshold (int, default: 18)
second_peak_threshold (int, default: 25)
neighbor_threshold (int, default: 3)
lr_threshold (int, default: 24)

The remaining parameters are listed in the Intel-ROS realsense Github repo

Topics

Topics are published in a namespace defined by the camera argument (default: camera) Camera streams are published under a subnamespace defined by the relevant argument (default: color, depth, ir, ir2)

Color images are transmitted using the image_transport interface. The images are represented by an 8 bit, 3 channel static byte array
